thread.title: Australian woman towed for driving to court on suspended licence charge
thread.title_full: Australian woman towed for driving to court on suspended licence charge

author: Heather McNeill
title: Australian woman towed for driving to court on suspended licence charge
text:
Australian woman towed for driving to court on suspended licence charge HEATHER MCNEILL Last updated 20:58, February 20 2017 TWITTER/PERTH POLICE 
What happens when you drive yourself to a suspended licence charge. 
If you're heading to court for a suspended licence charge, it's probably not wise to drive yourself there, as one red-faced woman in Australia found out. 
The woman was due at Perth Magistrate's Court for a hearing and opted to driver herself there. 
Perth Police seized the driver's car after the woman allegedly admitted she had driven it to court without a licence, to face charges related to having her licence suspended. 
Now, an already bad day for the driver has been made worse, with police adding another charge to her rap sheet for driving while suspended.
